metadata.title: CVE-2017-7187 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
The sg_ioctl function in drivers/scsi/sg.c in the Linux kernel through4.10.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (stack-based bufferoverflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a large commandsize in an SG_NEXT_CMD_LEN ioctl call, leading to out-of-bounds writeaccess in the sg_write function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

No subscription required
